column4: does ubuntu have a firewall installed by default that might block port 1723?
thers are no default firewall rules to block anuything
check with sudo iptables -L (or was it --list)  to see all rules
it comes out empty with nothing listed
i guess my isp is blocking port 1723 then because i portforward it to my ubuntu and still shows as blocked
it starts installing.. then asks quetions. :)
thats very nice
'wubi' is a feature/tool on the cd tht installs to a file 'inside' windows.
its a feature inside the ubuntu cd?
'wubi.exe' is included on the cd.. or you can download wubi.exe and it will download a cd/iso file.
i dont reccomend  Wubi.
why not? just curious
it has a tendency to break badly. (but thats from someone that sits in here all day and SEES people come in with wubi issues)
ah i see.. hmm
if you want to 'test' out ubuntu, i would suggest trying it in virtualbox.  or doing a normal install.
actually i wanted to try wubi itself.. but if it does have alot of issues, i might just stick with a vm
there sproberly 4+ people a day in here with wubi issues.. that basically no one in here really knows the proper ways to 'fix' :)
since most of us DONT use wubi.
yeah tahts understandable.. but from what you see, do you remember if the majority have the same kind of issues? or different
things like 'updated grub.. wubi dont boot, now what...' ive no idea how to proeprly fix grub on wubi. :)
or windows updated and breaks somthing.
